title: ATLANTIC RECORDS multiple FONT ID's
content:
Looking for font ID's on these two Atlantic logos probably from the 70s. If anybody can name the "Stereo One" underneath the first Atlantic logo in addition to the ATLANTIC font, that would be much appreciated as well. Thanks in advance,  
Danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410094454im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Atlantic1_5675.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410094454im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Atlantic2_4858.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Atlantic1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410094454/http:/typophile.com/files/Atlantic1.jpg) | 114.62 KB |
| [Atlantic2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410094454/http:/typophile.com/files/Atlantic2.jpg) | 85.31 KB |
author: Danny_Miller

comments.content: The first one is Eurostyle Bold Extended. The second looks hand drawn based on an American gothic.
thanks scott d. so if i intend to find a comporable font for the second one, should i look up 'american gothic' fonts on some font websites?
It's similar to fonts like Franklin Gothic, News Gothic, Trade Gothic, etc. You can search for "gothic" to find similar, but be prepared to sort through many results.
